column5: Hello all,  Just wanted to introduce myself. My name is Kevin and i'm from Sturgeon Falls. By the looks of it i'm one of many people fishing Nipissing on this site. I hope to be able to share alot of information with everyone, I mostly fish for walleye, smallmouth bass and pike, although i've finally decided to start musky fishing this year. I can't wait 'till it opens here.  Looking forward to becoming part of the community.  Kev
Welcome to a great board.  You wont find a better group to talk with  All the best  Dave
be careful ... once you start there's no turning back ... this place is addictive lol.  welcome aboard.
Welcome to OFC Kev!  Cheers  Jen
Welcome aboard Kev. Hmmm ... wonder if there is anuyone else we know from the Sturgeon Falls area ?

Welcome to a great family and community.  Looks like you will have some great posts from Nipissing and look forward to reading them.  Enjoy the new venture for musky it can get addictive.  Jump on and enjoy the ride on the OFC train.
Welcome....there's alot of great and helpfull people...looking forward to some of your reports.  Jason
I logged in last October and haven't left the keyboard since...LOL.  Welcome to the site...looking forward to your reports and pictures!
Welcome to the zoo, but as mentioned be careful as we are addictive.  Maureen

l use to drag race on the Srugeon stretch all the time in the late 70's. Welcome to the wacky world of OFC. Got my girlfriend here a month ago and she is about to beat me in posts. It is addictive,l think l will have to get her help or did l make her nuts. Peace Ken
Welcome to the community Kev   Looks like you have received the addiction warning, enjoy! Looking forward to reading your posts/reports!   bly
Well, I guess i've been warned, but i think that there's nothing i can do about it now.  thx for the warm welcome everyone.

Welcome Kevin, I'll be heading up to your neck of the woods 2nd week of July(7th) (west nipissing resort) with my 13yr old grandson and wife. I find its always important to find fish quickly to get the trip off to a good start for him. Mainly pike and bass fishermen (fledgling muskie fisherman) total catch and release. Should I target pike or bass first to get off to good start?  Thanks
Welcome to the board Kev. Lots of great advice when we aren't ripping the Senators!
I'm the girlfriend....he did make me nuts... does make me nuts.  Welcome to OFC...truly a great site.
